Extended: Allows comparators to detect item frames on a full block behind the comparator

recommended that you set this on permanently, and restart the server for best results

This was mostly made for the auto crafting table, since the performance boost is much more visible while using that mod

name: optimizedFurnaces

name: reIntroduceOnlyAutoSaveSaving
description: Re-introduces only saving during autosaves instead of any time
extras: Reverts 'saving chunks whenever there is time spare to reduce autosave spikes' from 20w12a
This makes your hard drive work overtime, so people with slow drives might suffer from this. This fixes that!

name: reIntroduceVeryAggressiveSaving
description: Re-introduces very aggressive saving by removing the chunk save cooldown that was added in 22w05a
extras: For obvious reasons, this does not work when `reIntroduceOnlyAutoSaveSaving` is enabled

name: reIntroduceFallingBlockEntityPhase
description: Re-introduces falling blocks giving block updates during the entity phase changed in 22w03a

name: reIntroducePistonTranslocation
description: Re-introduces piston translocation from 1.10

name: reIntroduceProperGoalTimings
description: Re-introduces or better said, reverts an optimization made in 21w39a that broken many entity goal
extras: Technically this was an optimization so enabling this rule will most likely come at a performance cost!

name: maxChunksSavedPerAutoSave
description: Allows you to change the max amount of chunks that can save per autosave
extras: If your server has large lag spikes due to chunk saving

name: maxChunksSavedPerTick
description: Allows you to change the max amount of chunks that can save per tick for the 1.18 chunk saving system
extras: This is for the system which just attempt to save chunks every tick. Max chunks saved per tick

name: delayBetweenAutoSaves
description: Allows you to change the delay between autosaves in ticks
extras: Shortening this number will make your server save more often which will also spread the load on the server

name: maxTickLatency
description: Allows you to change max tick delay before a task is cancelled
extras: Lower value raises the task leniency. Basically lower number means higher chance of success

name: statusUpdateDelay
description: Allows you to change how long the server player list wait before updating
extras: delay is in nanoseconds. Default is 5 seconds (5000000000) [1m,10s,5s,1s]

name: toggleOnlineMode
description: Allows you to toggle onlinemode without needing to restart the server

name: togglePreventProxyConnections
description: Allows you to toggle preventing proxy connections without needing to restart the server

name: togglePvpEnabled
description: Allows you to toggle pvpenabled without needing to restart the server

name: toggleFlightEnabled
description: Allows you to toggle flightenabled without needing to restart the server

name: toggleEnforceWhitelist
description: Allows you to toggle enforcing the whitelist without needing to restart the server

name: chunkSaveCooldownDelay
description: Allows you to change the chunk save cooldown added in 22w05a
extras: Set to 10s by default, this is the delay between chunks aggressively saving
If your server has large lag spikes due to chunk saving, you can raise this number.
For obvious reasons, this rule is disabled when `reIntroduceVeryAggressiveSaving` is enabled

extras: Whether the weather can change naturally. The `/weather` command can still change weather

name: drowningDamage
description: Deal drowning damage
extras: Whether the player should take damage when drowning

name: fallDamage
description: Deal fall damage
extras: Whether the player should take fall damage

name: fireDamage
description: Deal fire damage
extras: Whether the player should take damage in fire

name: forgiveDeadPlayers
description: Forgive dead players
extras: Angered neutral mobs stop being angry when the targeted player dies nearby

name: freezeDamage
description: Deal freeze damage
extras: Whether the player should take damage when inside powder snow

name: keepInventory
description: Keep inventory after death
extras: Whether the player should keep items and experience in their inventory after death

name: logAdminCommands
description: Broadcast admin commands
extras: Whether to log admin commands to server log

name: maxCommandChainLength
description: Command chain size limit
extras: The maximum length of a chain of commands that can be executed during one tick. Applies to command blocks and functions

name: maxEntityCramming
description: Entity cramming threshold
extras: The maximum number of pushable entities a mob or player can push, before taking 3 suffocation damage per half-second.
Setting to 0 or lower disables the rule.
Damage affects survival-mode or adventure-mode players, and all mobs but bats. Pushable entities include non-spectator-mode players, any mob except bats, as well as boats and minecarts.

name: mobGriefing
description: Allow destructive mob actions
extras: Whether creepers, zombies, endermen, ghasts, withers, ender dragons, rabbits, sheep, villagers, silverfish, snow golems, and end crystals should be able to change blocks and whether mobs can pick up items, which also disables bartering
This also affects the capability of zombie-like creatures like zombified piglins and drowned to pathfind to turtle eggs

name: naturalRegeneration
description: Regenerate health
extras: Whether the player can regenerate health naturally if their hunger is full enough
Doesn't affect external healing, such as golden apples, the Regeneration effect, etc.

name: playersSleepingPercentage
description: Sleep percentage
extras: The percentage of players who must be sleeping to skip the night

name: randomTickSpeed
description: Random tick speed rate
extras: How often a random block tick occurs (such as plant growth, leaf decay, etc.) per chunk section per game tick
0 and negative values disables random ticks, higher numbers increase random ticks
Setting to a high integer results in high speeds of decay and growth
Numbers over 4096 make plant growth or leaf decay instantaneous

name: reducedDebugInfo
description: Reduce debug info
extras: Limits contents of debug screen

name: sendCommandFeedback
description: Send command feedback
extras: Whether the feedback from commands executed by a player should show up in chat
Also affects the default behavior of whether command blocks store their output text

name: showDeathMessages
description: Show death messages
extras: Whether death messages are put into chat when a player dies
Also affects whether a message is sent to the pet's owner when the pet dies

name: spawnRadius
description: Respawn location radius
extras: The number of blocks outward from the world spawn coordinates that a player spawns in when first joining a server or when dying without a personal spawnpoint

name: spectatorsGenerateChunks
description: Allow spectators to generate terrain
extras: Whether players in spectator mode can generate chunks

name: universalAnger
description: Universal anger

name: commandPlayerMe

name: maxHostileSpawnLightLevel
description: Adjusts the maximum light level general hostile mobs can spawn in
extras: When maxHostileSpawnLightLevel < 7, block light level is used to determine whether the position
is considered \"dark\" or not, while leaving spawn chances at and below the maximum light level intact
When maxHostileSpawnLightLevel > 7, the upper bound of the random integer generator is increased
in order to accommodate for higher light levels, thereby affecting mob spawning chances at light
levels > 0 and <= 7, most likely increasing mob spawning chances over vanilla
validators: You must choose a light level from 0 to 15

extras: The /weird command allows for chunk monitoring as well as other weird additions that need more arguments then a carpet rule

name: observerDelay
description: Change the delay length of observers (how long it takes to turn on)

name: observerPulse
description: Change the pulse length of observers (how long it stays on)

name: anvilColorFormatting
description: Allows the use of spigot formatting inside of anvils
extras: To see formatting codes use /weird color

name: fastPistons
description: Pistons will extend and retract with 1 tick of delay

name: movableMovingPiston
description: Makes moving_piston (b36) movable. requires movableblockentities to be on. very unstable and made for the fun of proving it can be done!
validators: MovableBlockEntities must be enabled to use this

name: blockUpdateHell
description: Basically all setblock calls will use this number
extras: Custom block updates from: -1 to 127 | use -2 to disable
validators: You must choose a value from -2 to 127

name: spongeEverything
description: Makes it so that sponges can absorb all blocks :}

name: spongeLimit
description: Change the max amount of that a sponge can absorb

name: spongeLava
description: The sponge now absorbs lava instead of water, you happy now?

name: spongeInfinite
description: Removes all restrictions that sponges have
extras: You can still change the spongeLimit to avoid crashing. spongeLimit is ignored if its the default value!

name: spongeFaster
description: Modify sponges so that the blocks they remove don't create blockupdates
extras: Only noticeable when using spongeInfinite

name: spongeCeption
description: Sponge, sponges itself

name: spongeReusable
description: Sponge does not become wet when used
extras: If spongeCeption is enabled

name: spongeAbsorbsExplosions
description: Sponge will prevent block explosion damage if its in the tnt list of blocks to break

name: enchantmentOverride
description: Allows you to enchant past the highest vanilla enchant limit using /enchant
extras: Also makes it so every enchantment works on all items

name: uncappedTridentSpeed
description: Makes it so that tridents can move just as fast as they usually do on the y-axis on the x & z axis

name: executeBlockLimit
description: Customizable execute volume limit
extras: It's weird cause nobody knows this limit exists xD
validators: You must choose a value from 1 to 20M

name: scaffoldingBreaking
description: Scaffolding breaking rules. change how scaffolding breaks

name: instantLiquidFlow
description: Instant-liquid flow in 1.16, basically instant tile ticks but for liquids

name: fastLiquidFlow
description: Makes all liquid ticks happen within the next tick

name: fastTileTicks
description: Makes all tile ticks happen within the next tick

name: instantTileTick
description: Re-implementing instant tile ticks into 1.16. although it's more of an imitation

name: instantTileTickMechanic
description: A game mechanic for instant tick ticks. requires a lit redstone lamp to be moved in border chunks surrounded by ticking chunks
extras: Also makes it so that instantTileTick crashes the server when generating new chunks
vanilla makes it so that instantLiquidFlow works with instantTileTicks like its does in 1.12

name: instantFall
description: Re-implementing instant fall into 1.16, what could possibly go wrong

name: instantFallMechanic
description: A game mechanic for instant fall. requires a lit redstone lamp to be moved in border chunks surrounded by border chunks.
extras: Also makes it so that instantFall turns off when generating new chunks.

name: preventBreaking
description: Prevents all players from breaking blocks

name: permaloader
description: This is a joke, it actually just prevents all chunks from being unloaded ;)

name: blueSkullTesting
description: Makes it so blue skulls from wither always spawn to test if your wither based farm will break
extras: Entity: Makes it so skulls have a 100% chance of spawning when wither is targeting an entity
Passive: Makes it so theres 100% chance of blue skulls spawning passively

name: blockTransparency
description: Makes all the blocks in the game act like transparent blocks!

name: worldborderSpecial
description: Everything works the same past the world border

name: catOnChestBypass
description: Makes it so that cats on chests do not prevent the chest from opening

name: totallyLegitElytra
description: Elytra won't take damage from flight
extras: Requested by Pixeils

name: breakableDragonEgg
description: Allows the dragon egg to be mined

name: dragonAlwaysDropsEgg
description: Ender dragon always drops a dragon egg when killed

name: shulkerCancer
description: Shulkers can become cancer, just place a bunch of shulkers next to each other!

name: featherFallingPlus
description: Feather falling prevents trampling crops

description: Will send an entity position packet for every tick
extras: May cause severe network lag if too many entities are loaded

name: fallingBlockMechanic
description: A mechanic to make any block a falling block
extras: If a LIT lamp is moved under a beacon which has a fallingBlock above it

name: disableEntityInterpolation
description: Disabled client-side entity interpolation

name: easyWither
description: Makes the wither act as if the difficulty is easy

name: itemShadowingMechanic
description: Mechanic to create shadow items without a suppressor
extras: Lightning Mechanic: Lightning hitting an item frame on an inventory
will create a shadow item of the item in the frame and put it in the inventory.
Spectral Mechanic: Shooting an item frame on an inventory with a burning spectral arrow
will create a shadow item of the item in the frame and put it in the inventory.
Do this twice!

name: onlyUpdateWarn

Allows Trade Cycling Mod-like behavior in vanilla client.

name: enderDragonNoGriefing

name: commandModificationBlockLimit

extras: Number of blocks that can be changed at once by one command, such as fill or clone.

description: Vines spread
extras: Controls whether or not the Vines block spreads randomly to adjacent blocks. Does not affect other type of vine blocks such as Weeping Vines, Twisting Vines, etc.

name: doWardenSpawning
description: Spawn wardens

description: In mob explosions, some blocks won't drop their loot

description: Snow accumulation height
extras: When it snows, layers of snow form on the ground up to at most this number of layers.

name: tntExplosionDropDecay
description: In TNT explosions, some blocks won't drop their loot
extras: Some of the drops from blocks destroyed by explosions caused by TNT are lost in the explosion.

name: foxesSpawnWithSweetBerriesChance

name: allayableVexes

name: coralErosion

name: hugeMushroomsSpreadMycelium

name: renewableNetherrack

extras: What generates depends on the biome, with Nyliums generating in their respective forests and Netherrack elsewhere

name: renewableDeepslate
description: Allows Thick Potions to convert Stone into Deepslate, either by right-clicking or using a splash potion
extras: With no_splash: splash potion conversion is disabled.

name: renewableSwiftSneak
description: Allows Enchanting Tables near Wardens to enchant with Swift Sneak

name: maxWanderingTraderSpawnChance

extras: This starts at 0.025 and increases by 0.025 each time a trader spawn fails until the max chance is reached.

name: wanderingTraderSpawnRate
description: How often the Wandering Trader attempts to spawn in ticks

name: botTabListNamePrefix
description: Add a prefix to the Bot in the TabList, using & instead of § to format the text.

description: Add a suffix to the Bot in the TabList, using & instead of § to format the text.

name: disableParticlesPackets
description: Disable particle packet sending to reduce bandwidth usage.

name: dispenserCollectExperience
description: Dispenser firing glass bottles at players will convert to experience bottles.

name: noteBlockChunkLoader
description: When the note block is activated, if the top is obsidian and the bottom is emerald ore, it gives the block a load ticket equivalent to the nether portal.

name: opLevelBelowSelf
description: Operators can only grant the same or lower permissions to other players than themselves.

name: voidDevouringBehavior
description: The action that will occur when the player falls into the void.
extras: instant_death - Dies immediately when entering the void.
teleport_to_spawn - Teleport to the player's spawn point when entering the void, or to the world spawn point if it does not exist.

teleport_to_spawn_cost_totem - Teleport to the player's spawn point when entering the void, or to the world spawn point if it does not exist. This action consumes a totem, and if the player does not hold a totem they will receive void damage.

teleport_to_spawn_cost_totem_or_death - Teleport to the player's spawn point when entering the void, or to the world spawn point if it does not exist. This action consumes a totem, and if the player does not hold a totem they will die immediately.
vanilla - Vanilla behaviour.

name: disableOpsBypassWhitelist

the operation will consume 1 item from each component
WARNING: do not move the items with SHIFT
WARNING: do not close the GUI with a shadow stack in the crafting grid

extras: Zombies get replaced by husks in warm biomes, and skeletons get replaced by strays in cold biomes and bogged in swamp biomes.
This will not affect previously-generated chunks, so if you intend to feature this modification on a long-term survival world, it's best to enable the setting right away.

name: campfireRespawning

name: cobblestoneGenProduct

name: compactBannerTooltips

name: compactEnchantTooltips
description: Compacts the tooltips of enchantments by listing them as a cycling carousel
extras: For more information, check the designated Github wiki page!

name: compactPotTooltips

For more information, check the designated Github wiki page!

name: compactTemplateTooltips
description: Compacts the tooltips of smithing templates by removing the "Applies to" and "Ingredients" text
extras: For more information, check the designated Github wiki page!

name: compactTrimTooltips

extras: "No material" removes the material text but leaves the color formatting.
For more information, check the designated Github wiki page!

name: comparatorsReadThroughChains

name: comparatorsReadThroughPaths

name: comparatorsReadThroughPistons
description: Comparators can read through pistons, like in Bedrock Edition

name: composterSideInputs
description: Items can be inserted into composters from all 6 sides instead of just the top, via hoppers and droppers.

name: consistentExplosionImmunity
description: Explosion-immune blocks also apply this property to their dropped item counterparts
extras: Though marked as "Works As Intended", this rule technically fixes this bug: https://bugs.mojang.com/browse/MC-212764

name: consistentWaterlogPushing
description: Blocks will always conserve their waterlogged state upon being pushed by a piston, regardless of the length of the pulse
extras: Despite the intentional behavior clearly being for the water to vanish, this rule partly satisfies this open report: https://bugs.mojang.com/browse/MC-130202

name: copperBulbOxidationSignal
description: Comparators reading from copper bulbs output a signal strength based on the oxidation stage, instead of a binary output

name: crafterSignalLerping
description: Comparators output a signal strength from 1 to 15 instead of 1 to 9 when reading from crafters

name: cryingObsidianPortalFrames
description: Crying obsidian can be used in the frames of nether portals
extras: "Convert" will cause the obsidian in portal frames to slowly convert into crying obsidian

name: deepslateDungeons
description: Dungeons that generate below y = 0 will be made of cobbled deepslate instead of cobblestone
extras: This will not affect previously-generated chunks, so if you intend to feature this modification on a long-term survival world, it's best to enable the setting right away.

name: disableArmadilloShedding
description: Disables armadillos randomly shedding their scutes

name: disableBedTooFarWarning
description: Allows players to sleep when they are more than 3 blocks away from the bed

name: disableBedUnsafeWarning
description: Allows players to sleep when there are nearby monsters

name: disableDragonEggTeleportation
description: Disables dragon eggs teleporting when clicking on them

name: disableEndGatewayCrossing
description: Disables travelling through end gateways

name: disableEndPortalCrossing
description: Disables travelling through end portals

name: disableMaceKnockback
description: Disables maces knocking back entities upon a successful hit

name: disableNetherPortalCrossing
description: Disables travelling through nether portals

name: disablePetAttacking
description: Disables players harming tamed mobs
extras: "Owned" allows players to hit pets that aren't their own.

name: disablePiglinBlockGuarding
description: Disables aggravating nearby piglins by interacting with certain blocks
extras: "Open" allows players to open containers without being attacked.
"Sneaking" allows players to break containers safely while sneaking.

name: disablePrematureBlockFalling
description: Disables shape updates scheduling gravity-affected blocks to fall even when they aren't able to

name: disableShulkerReproduction
description: Disables shulkers duplicating when hit by bullets
extras: Intended to be used in tandem with carpet's shulkerSpawningInEndCities.

name: disableWaterMiningSlowdown
description: Disables the mining speed debuff when submerged in water

name: dispensersBuryItems
description: Allows dispensers to bury custom item stacks inside sand or gravel, turning them into suspicious blocks which players can brush

name: dragonEggFallingDelay
description: The time it takes for dragon eggs to fall after receiving a shape update, in ticks

name: endExitIgnoreLeaves
description: Players teleporting back to spawn from the end dimension will ignore leaves when deciding where to land, just like other entities

name: endPlatformSillyString
description: Removes the extra setBlock() call that prevents string-based generation suppression being usable on the end platform
extras: "No drops" prevents the intersecting blocks from dropping as items, for the most part restoring pre-1.21 behavior.

name: expandedFenceConnectivity
description: Allows fences to connect to walls and glass panes

name: fastLeafDecayingChance
description: The chance per gametick of leaves decaying when their supporting logs are removed
extras: 0 restores vanilla randomTick behavior, and 0.075 is the value that matches the behavior of Vanilla Tweaks' datapack.

name: fireAspectLighting
description: Items enchanted with fire aspect can be used to light campfires, candles and TNT, like in Bedrock Edition

name: forceGrassSpreading
description: Grass and mycelium can instantly spread to adjacent dirt, when the dirt is fertilized with bonemeal
extras: This behaves the same as nylium in vanilla.

name: grassAgingChance
description: The chance per randomTick of a grass block growing short and tall grass naturally
extras: 0 restores vanilla grass block behavior, i.e. not growing any short or tall grass naturally.

name: growableSwampOakTrees
description: Oak saplings grow into swamp oaks in swamp biomes

name: highlightSleepDeprivers
description: Clicking a bed applies the glowing effect to monsters that are actively preventing sleep

name: hopperTransferTime
description: The time it takes for a hopper to transfer an item, in ticks

name: huskWashing
description: Adult husks drop 1-3 sand when converting into zombies

name: incrediblySecretSetting
description: §kblblblbllblblbblblblblblblbl§r :3

name: insomniaDayCount
description: The number of sleepless nights after which phantoms can spawn around the player

name: itemMagnetRange
description: The range at which items will slowly gravitate towards the player
extras: This is different from the item pickup range!

name: itemMagnetVelocity
description: The velocity at which items will gravitate towards the player in x / (the distance from the item to the player in blocks)^2
extras: This requires that itemMagnetRange is set above 0.

name: jukeboxDiscProgressSignal
description: Comparators reading from jukeboxes output a signal strength based on how much of the music disc has been played, instead of the disc index

name: lavaFlowSpeedDefault
description: The time it takes for lava to flow one block in the overworld or end, in ticks.

name: lavaFlowSpeedNether
description: The time it takes for lava to flow one block in the nether, in ticks.

name: lazyLoadedShearSuppression
description: Mobs in lazy chunks can be sheared without updating, like in Bedrock Edition

name: leavesNoCollision
description: Disables the tangibility of leaves, making it easier to traverse areas with lots of trees

name: maxSugarcaneGrowthHeight
description: The maximum height sugarcane can grow to in blocks

name: moreTimeArgumentUnits
description: Adds minute (m), hour (h) and week (w) units to time arguments in commands

name: movableEnchantingTables
description: Enchanting tables can be pushed with pistons
extras: Requires that movableBlockEntities is enabled.

name: movableEnderChests
description: Ender chests can be pushed with pistons
extras: Requires that movableBlockEntities is enabled.

name: mossSpreadToCobblestone
description: Moss can convert nearby cobblestone to mossy cobblestone when fertilized
extras: This feature is controlled through doormat/worldgen/configured_feature/mossy_cobblestone_patch.json.

name: mossSpreadToStoneBricks
description: Moss can convert nearby stone bricks to mossy stone bricks when fertilized
extras: This feature is controlled through doormat/worldgen/configured_feature/mossy_stone_bricks_patch.json.

name: openDoubleDoors
description: Doors connected via opposite hinges pair their open or close state changes

name: obsidianGenProduct
description: The block produced when water meets still lava

name: peacefulMonsterSpawning
description: Hostile mobs can passively spawn in peaceful mode
extras: For more information, check the designated Github wiki page!

name: persistentRespawnAnchorCharge
description: Disables respawn anchor charges decrementing when the player respawns.

name: phantomMinSpawnAltitude
description: The minimum y height the player needs to be standing at in order to spawn phantoms

name: pistonMovementTime
description: The time it takes for a piston to fully extend or retract, in ticks

name: playersDropAllXp
description: Players drop all of their XP on death instead of a capped amount

name: portalForceTicking
description: Nether portal blocks randomTick when lit, like in Bedrock Edition

name: powderSnowPortalBreaking
description: Powder snow can be used to break nether portals, like in Bedrock Edition

name: propagulePropagation
description: Mangrove propagules actually propagate, falling from trees and planting themselves automatically

name: qcSuppressor
description: Emerald ore breaks the quasi-connection between components and power sources

name: ravagersStompPlants
description: Ravagers can break plants, like in Bedrock Edition

name: ravagersStompSnow
description: Ravagers can break snow layers, like in Bedrock Edition

name: reachAroundBridging
description: Blocks can be placed by aiming in front of the block you're standing on, like in Bedrock Edition

name: redstoneOpensBarrels
description: Powering barrels with redstone forces them open

name: spawnersGenerateCobwebs
description: Cave spider spawners generate cobwebs between nearby solid faces each spawn cycle
extras: For more information, check the designated Github wiki page!

name: renewableGildedBlackstone
description: The chance per randomTick of blackstone adjacent to underwater magma blocks becoming gilded
extras: 0 restores vanilla behavior, i.e. never becoming gilded.

name: renewableSporeBlossoms
description: Spore blossoms generate underneath fertilized moss blocks

name: retroRepeaterDelay
description: Repeaters have delays of 2, 4, 10 and 14 ticks respectively, like they did during development of beta 1.3

name: safeSand
description: Floating gravity-affected blocks are stable until receiving an update from the underside, preventing cave-ins and quicksand

name: sculkCatalystXpCount
description: The amount of XP dropped from mining a sculk catalyst
extras: 20 is the value that matches the behavior from before 1.19.1pre6.

name: sneakingRandomTickChance
description: The chance each time you sneak for a nearby block to get randomTicked
extras: 0 restores vanilla behavior, i.e. not accelerating growth by sneaking.

name: softInversion
description: Redstone torches placed on the sides of pistons deactivate when the piston extends, like in Bedrock Edition

name: snowFormsUnderLeaves
description: Snow layers accumulate under leaves instead of on top during snowstorms.

name: solidEntityCollision
description: Living entities can be collided with like boats

name: solidHoney
description: Honey blocks behave like solid blocks, like they do in Bedrock Edition

name: sporeBlossomDuplication
description: Spore blossoms drop themselves when fertilized, the same way tall flowers do

name: stickyPillarBlocks
description: Pillar blocks like logs and bone blocks stick to each other based on the axis direction when moved
extras: "Stick to all" causes them to connect to each other regardless of axis direction.

name: stickyStickyPistons
description: Sticky pistons act like directional slime blocks
extras: "Stick to all" causes them to stick omnidirectionally like normal slime blocks.

name: stoneGenProduct
description: The block produced when lava flows on top of water

name: suspiciousLootAmountFix
description: Item stacks buried in suspicious sand or gravel drop their expected amount when brushed instead of a random number between 10-30
extras: This rule fixes this bug: https://bugs.mojang.com/browse/MC-260225

name: suspiciousLootDropPosFix
description: Brushing suspicious sand or gravel aligns the dropped loot against the block face
extras: This rule fixes this bug: https://bugs.mojang.com/browse/MC-272398

name: torchBurnoutFlickerAmount
description: The number of times a redstone torch must flicker within the allocated timespan in order to burn out

name: torchBurnoutTime
description: The allocated time a torch has to reach its flicker count in order to burn out, in ticks
extras: 40 is the value that matches Bedrock Edition's behavior, assuming the default flicker amount value

name: trialSpawnerEntityRequirement
description: The types of entities to check around the trial spawner before spawning mobs

name: villagersAlwaysInheritBiome
description: Baby villagers will always assume the clothing of the biome they're born in
extras: Intended to be used in tandem with the in-built trade rebalance experimental toggle.

name: waterFlowSpeed
description: The time it takes for water to flow one block, in ticks.

name: woolDesertPyramids
description: The terracotta details on desert pyramids will be made of wool instead, like before 1.8
extras: This will not affect previously-generated chunks, so if you intend to feature this modification on a long-term survival world, it's best to enable the setting right away.

name: zoglinPortalSpawnChance
description: The chance of a zoglin spawning inside a nether portal instead of a zombified piglin
extras: 0 restores vanilla behavior, i.e. never spawning zoglins.

name: commandQC
description: Enables /quasiconnectivity command to toggle quasi-power capability for individual redstone components

name: commandDelay
description: Enables /delay command to change the delay of individual redstone components

name: commandUpdateType
description: Enables /updatetype command to change the updates individual redstone components emit when changing state

name: commandTickPriority
description: Enables /tickpriority command to change the tick priority of the scheduled block ticks sent by individual redstone components

name: commandRandomTick
description: Enables /randomtick command to forcibly send randomTicks to the specified block position

name: stonecuttersDoDamage
description: When a stonecutter is powered by redstone, it will damage entities standing on top of it.

name: commandItemShadowing
description: Enable /itemshadowing command to create a shadow of the item in the main hand

name: setBedrockHardness
description: Set the hardness of bedrock

name: bindingCurseInvalidation
description: Enable player to take off armors with binding curse enchantments

name: disableOpenOrWaterDetection
description: Disable detection of open water in fishing, thus allowing fishing for treasures in any water

name: sculkShriekerCanSummon
description: Enable sculk shrieker placed by player to summon warden

name: creativeImmuneKill
description: Make player in creative mode immune to /kill command

name: itemNeverDespawn
description: Disable the despawning of items

name: flyingUseOnBlockFirework
description: Limit fire rocket only to be used when flying

name: staringEndermanNotAngry
description: Disable enderman getting angry when player stares at them

name: farmlandPreventStepping
description: Prevent farmland from being trampled

name: maxBlockPlaceDistance
description: Set the maximum block placement distance
extras: Also works for blocks breaking and interaction

name: simpleUpdateSkipper
description: Backport update skipper before 1.20-pre2 by disconnecting the redstone wire and prevent comparator dropping over tripdoors

name: channelingIgnoreWeather
description: Ignore the weather condition when using channeling enchantment

name: notDamageEnderPearl
description: Disable the falling damage when using ender pearl

name: protectionEnchantmentCompatible
description: Allow all protection enchantments to be compatible

name: disableDamageImmunity
description: Disable the immunity after sustaining damage

name: hayBlockCompleteOffsetFall
description: Disable the falling damage when landing on hay block

name: blueIceCanSpawn
description: Prevent mobs from naturally spawning on blue ice

name: disableBatCanSpawn
description: Prevent bats from naturally spawning

name: turtleEggFastHatch
description: Make turtle eggs always crack when random ticked, rather than cracking with a 1/500 chance

name: openShulkerBoxForcibly
description: Allow players to open the shulker box forcibly, even for those boxes blocked by a solid blocks

name: villagerInfiniteTrade
description: Allow infinitely trading with villagers

name: fireworkRocketUseCooldown
description: Add a cooldown for using firework rocket

name: riptideIgnoreWeather
description: Ignore the weather condition when using riptide enchantment

name: disablePiglinZombify
description: Prevent piglins from zombifying

name: disableVillagerWitch
description: Prevent villagers from turning into witches

name: disableIronGolemAttackPlayer
description: Prevent iron golems from attacking players

name: pickaxeMinedBedrock
description: Make bedrock mineable with pickaxe

name: villagerHeal
description: Heal villagers for 1 health every 4 seconds

name: fakePlayerHeal
description: Heal fake players for 1 health every 2 seconds

name: damageEnchantmentCompatible
description: Allow all damage enchantments to be compatible

name: commandPlayerTools
description: Enable /playertools command for fake player manipulation

name: maxBlockPlaceDistanceReferToEntity
description: Make entities within maxBlockPlaceDistance reachable

name: renewableSwiftSneak
description: Librarian can sell enchantment book of swift sneak now

name: knockbackStick
description: Enable knockback stick, i.e. stick with knockback enchantment

name: disableRespawnBlocksExplode
description: Disable the explosion of respawn blocks, e.g. beds or respawn anchors

name: CCEUpdateSuppression
description: By naming a shulker box with a specified name, an "ClassCastException"-based update suppressor can be created

name: openSeedPermissions
description: Allow players without permission to use /seed command

name: commandSendMessage
description: Enable /sendMessage command for sending copiable message or urls

name: openCarpetPermissions
description: Allow /carpet in command singleplayer game

name: openGameRulePermissions
description: Allow players without permission to use /gamerule command

name: openVillagerInventory
description: Allow to open villager inventory when sneaking

name: peacefulCreeper
description: Creeper will not attack player

name: commandXpTransfer
description: Enable /xpTransfer to transfer experience between players

name: commandSpectator
description: Enable /spectator to switch between spectator and survival mode

name: commandFinder
description: Enable /finder command to search for blocks or items in certain ranges

name: commandKillMe
description: Enable /killme command to kill the player itself

name: commandLocations
description: Enable /locations command for location marker management

name: healthNotFullCanEat
description: You can eat food when full if your health is not full and saturation level less than 5

name: canMineSpawner
description: Make spawner mineable with silk touch tools

name: fakePlayerSpawnNoKnockback
description: Remove the knockback, burning time and falling distance when fake players respawning

name: canActivatesObserver
description: Enable flint and steel used to directly activate observers

name: disableOutOfOrderChatCheck
description: Disable the checking for order of chat packages

name: disableWaterFreezes
description: Disable water freezing in cold biomes

name: fakePlayerCraftKeepItem
description: Keep at least one item in inventory for each from recipes when fake players crafting items, unless it is an unstackable item
extras: Also works for fake players trading

name: commandParticleLine
description: Enable /particleLine command to draw a line connecting two points with particle effects

name: disableMobPeacefulDespawn
description: Keep entities with "PersistenceRequired" tag (With naming, etc.) from despawning in peaceful mode

name: climbingBoat
description: Enable boat drove by player to climb up one block high

name: reusableSmithingTemplate
description: Disable the consumption of smithing template when smithing
extras: false: Disable this rule
true: All smithing templates will not consumed
upgrade: Only netherite upgrade smithing template are preserved

name: openTpPermissions
description: Allow players without permission to use /tp command

name: softDeepslate
description: Set the hardness of deepslate and its variants to be the same as stone or cobblestone

name: softObsidian
description: Set the hardness of obsidian to be the same as end stone

name: softOres
description: Set the hardness of ores to be the same as the corresponding stone, deepslate or end stone

name: betterTotemOfUndying
description: Undying Totem could function as long as it is in the inventory
extras: fasle: Disable this rule
shulker_box: Function as if undying totem is in the inventory, including in shulker box
true: Function as if undying totem is in the inventory, but excluding those in shulker box

name: commandPlayerAction
description: Enable /playerAction command to allow fake players to automatically perform some actions

name: fakePlayerCraftPickItemFromShulkerBox
description: Enable fake players to pick items from shulker boxes when crafting

name: customPiglinBarteringTime
description: Customize the time required for piglin bartering

name: quickSettingFakePlayerCraft
description: Open the fake player crafting GUI directly by right-clicking the fake player with a workbench in mainhand, requiring the player to have the permission to execute the /playerAction command
extras: false: Disable this rule
sneaking: Only when sneaking
true: Can always open

name: wetSpongeImmediatelyDry
description: Wet sponge can be dried immediately
extras: false: Disable this rule (Dried immediately only in nether as in vanilla)
arid: Any arid biomes (biomes that have no rain)
all: Dried immediately in any biomes
disable: Wet sponge will not dried immediately even in nether

name: fakePlayerKeepInventory
description: Keep inventories and experience when fake player dies

name: commandCreeper
description: Enable /creeper command to make a creeper explosion around the specified player. The explosion only damages entities, and cause no block damages

name: commandRuleSearch
description: Enable /ruleSearch to search for carpet rules with the specified string in the translated name

name: superChargedCreeper
description: Drop a head for each entity when killed by a charged creeper

name: playerDropHead
description: Player drops head when killed by a charged creeper

name: beaconRangeExpand
description: Extend range of beacon to specified distance
extras: The value could be negative to shrink the range

name: beaconWorldHeight
description: Set the vertical range of beacon to the entire world height

name: mobWhetherOrNotCanPickItem
description: Set whether items could be picked up by mobs
extras: no: No mobs can pick up items
vanilla: Vanilla behaviour
yes: Any mobs can pick up items
yes_only_hostile: Any hostile mobs can pick up items, while others keep vanilla behaviour
no_only_hostile: Any hostile mobs cannot pick up items, while others keep vanilla behaviour

name: canHighlightBlockPos
description: Add a button for highlight path point on the right of block position text. Requiring OMMC as a client-side mod

name: commandPlayerManager
description: Enable /playerManager command to manage fake players login

name: blockDropsDirectlyEnterInventory
description: Item dropping from mining will directly enter the player's inventory

name: turtleEggFastMine
description: Player can mine multiple turtle eggs at once

name: commandNavigate
description: Enable /navigate command to guide players to a specific location

name: playerDropsNotDespawning
description: Set the Age of player drops to -32768 to prevent them from despawning

name: fakePlayerMaxCraftCount
description: Customize the maximizing crafting count of fake players in one game tick
extras: -1 represents no limit

name: commandMail
description: Enable the /mail command to ship items to other players

name: suppressionMismatchInDestroyBlockPosWarn
description: To prevent the warning "Mismatch in destroy block pos: {} {}" from being output in the log

name: fakePlayerSpawnMemoryLeakFix
description: Fix memory leak issue caused by spawning fake player when fabric api is installed simultaneously

name: cheatRestriction
description: Prohibits specific features in client-side mods such as tweakeroo, tweakermore, litematica. The features to restrict can be configure using the /restriction command. Only works in server side

name: commandListRestriction
description:
Enables /listrestriction command to display features restricted by cheatRestriction.
/listrestriction command provides the same output as /restriction when used with no arguments.
However, unlike /restriction, this command can be executed by players without operator permissions by default.

name: commandRestriction
description: Enables /restriction command to configure features restricted by cheatRestriction.

name: debugModeAmaCarpet
description: Enables debug print for AmaCarpet developers.

name: disableAnimalSpawnOnChunkGen
description: Disables animal spawning during chunk generation.

name: disableSoundEngine
description: Disables all server-side sound engine processes

name: endGatewayChunkLoad
description: Allows entities traveling through end gateway portals to load a 3x3 chunk area, similar to nether portals.

name: endPortalChunkLoad
description: Allows entities traveling through end portals to load a 3x3 chunk area, similar to nether portals.

name: notifySyncmatica
description: Sends notifications to player's chat when a schematic is shared or unshared using syncmatica.

name: reloadPortalTicket
description: Reloads all Nether portal chunk-loading tickets during server startup. This ensures that chunk loaders remain functional after server restarts.

name: requireAmaCarpetClient
description: Prevents clients without AmaCarpet installed from logging in. The timeout duration can be configured with requireAmaCarpetClientTimeoutSeconds

name: requireAmaCarpetClientTimeoutSeconds
description: Timeout duration for checking if the client has AmaCarpet within the range 1 to 180 seconds.

name: stackableUnstackables
description: Use this format to create unstackable -> stackable items: [{"id":"minecraft:totem_of_undying","amount":16},{"id":"minecraft:water_bucket","amount":64}] * i really hate obfuscation mappings - veyga

name: playerLeash
description: Allows players to leash other players with leads

name: antiSpamDisabled
description: Disable spamming checks on players, including: chat message cooldown, creative item drop cooldown

name: blockEventPacketRange
description: Set the range where player will receive a block event packet after a block event fires successfully
extras: For piston the packet is used to render the piston movement animation. Decrease it to reduce client's lag

name: blockPlacementIgnoreEntity
description: Disable entity collision check before block placement, aka you can place blocks inside entities
extras: Works with creative mode players only

name: breedingCooldownDisabled
description: Remove breeding cooldown of all kinds of mobs

name: cauldronBlockItemInteractFix
description: Make player be able to place block against cauldron block with any filled level
extras: Affected Minecraft <= 1.16.x. This annoying behavior is already been fixed in 1.17+

name: chatMessageLengthLimitUnlocked
description: Unlock the chat message / command string length limit
extras: The limit will be raised from 256 to 32000
Carpet TIS Addition is required to be installed on the client

name: chunkUpdatePacketThreshold
description: The threshold which the game will just send an chunk data packet if the amount of block changes is more than it
extras: Increasing this value might reduce network bandwidth usage, and boost client's fps if there are lots of tile entities in a chunk section with a lot of block changes
Set it to really high to simulate 1.16+ behavior, which is no chunk packet but only multiple block change packet
This rule is only available in <1.16

name: chunkTickSpeed
description: Modify how often the chunk tick occurs per chunk per game tick
extras: The default value is 1. Set it to 0 to disables chunk ticks
Affected game phases: thunder, ice and snow, randomtick
With a value of n, in every chunk every game tick, climate things will tick n times, and randomtick will tick n * randomTickSpeed times per chunk section

name: clientSettingsLostOnRespawnFix
description: Fixed stored client settings are not migrated from the old player entity during player respawn or entering end portal in the end
extras: So mods relies on client settings are always able to work correctly, e.g. serverside translation of this mod and worldedit mod

name: commandLifeTime
description: Enables /lifetime command to track entity lifetime and so on
extras: Useful for mob farm debugging etc.

name: commandManipulate
description: Enables /manipulate command for world related manipulation command

name: commandRaid
description: Enables /raid command for raid listing and tracking

name: commandRaycast
description: Enables /raycast command for debugging raycast

name: commandRefresh
description: Enables /refresh command for synchronizing your client to the server

name: commandRemoveEntity
description: Enables /removeentity command for directly erase target entities from the world

name: commandSleep
description: Enables /sleep command for creating lag

name: commandSpeedTest
description: Enables /speedtest command for network speed test
extras: You can change the maximum allowed test size with rule speedTestCommandMaxTestSize

name: creativeInstantTame
description: Let create player tame animals instantly
extras: Affects cat, wolf, parrot and horse-like animals

name: creativeNetherWaterPlacement
description: Allow creative players place water via water bucket in nether
extras: Technically this rule applies to all ultrawarm dimensions

name: creativeNoItemCooldown
description: Remove the cooldown of items used by the creative players
extras: e.g. the 20gt cooldown after throwing an ender pearl

name: creativeOpenContainerForcibly
description: Allow creative players to open a container even if the container is blocked. e.g. for shulker box

name: debugNbtQueryNoPermission
description: Remove the permission requirement for the debug nbt request of client's F3+I action
extras: In vanilla, the request needs permission level 2 at least
Carpet TIS Addition is required to be installed on the client

name: deobfuscateCrashReportStackTrace
description: Deobfuscate stack traces in crash report

name: dispenserNoItemCost
description: Dispensers and droppers execute without having the itemstack inside decreased
extras: Either dropping and using items do not cost, but dropper transferring item still costs

name: dispensersFireDragonBreath
description: Dispenser can fire dragon breath bottle to create a dragon breath effect cloud

name: elytraFireworkBoostOnBlockBackport
description: Backport the feature from Minecraft 1.21.6+ where using a firework item on a block while in elytra state will boost the player, instead of launching a firework
extras: Only works in Minecraft < 1.21.6

name: enchantCommandNoRestriction
description: Remove all enchantment restriction checks inside /enchant command

name: endPortalOpenedSoundDisabled
description: Disable the sound emitted when opening an end portal

name: entityBrainMemoryUnfreedFix
description: Fix brain memory of living entity staying unfreed after the entity has been removed
extras: This could lead to a memory leak if living entities remember other and then get removed continuously and create an endless memory chain in their brains
Fixed MC-260605, using the same fix that Mojang implemented in 1.19.4-pre3

name: entityInstantDeathRemoval
description: Remove the 20gt delay before living entity removal after death
extras: When enabled, living entities will despawn immediately after their death

name: entityMomentumLoss
description: Set it to false to disable entity axis momentum cancellation if it's above 10m/gt when being loaded from disk

name: entityPlacementIgnoreCollision
description: Disable block and entity collision check during entity placement with items
extras: Affected items: armorstand, end crystal, all kinds of boat
Spawn egg items are not affected

name: entityTrackerDistance
description: The maximum horizontal chebyshev distance (in chunks) for the server to sync entities information to the client
extras: Basically this works as a "entity view distance", but will still be limited to the server view distance
Set it to a value not less than the server view distance to make the server sync all entities within the view distance to the client
Set it to a non-positive value to use vanilla logic
Requires chunk reloading to set the new rule value to entities

name: entityTrackerInterval
description: The time interval (in gametick) for the server to sync entities information to the client
extras: With a small number e.g. 1, entity information will be synced to the client every 1 gametick, resulting in less-likely client-side entity desync
Set it to a non-positive value to use vanilla logic
Requires chunk reloading to set the new rule value to entities

name: explosionNoEntityInfluence
description: Explosions won't affect any entity
extras: Influences here include damage, acceleration etc.

name: explosionPacketRange
description: Set the range where player will receive an explosion packet when an explosion happens

name: failSoftBlockStateParsing
description: Ignore invalid property keys/values in block state arguments used in e.g. /setblock command
extras: In vanilla invalid property keys/values cause command failure when parsing, this rule suppresses that
Useful during cross-version litematica schematic pasting etc.

name: fakePlayerNamePrefix
description: Add a name prefix for fake players spawned with /player command
extras: Set it to #none to stop adding a prefix
Which can prevent summoning fake player with illegal names and make player list look nicer

name: fakePlayerNameSuffix
description: Add a name suffix for fake players spawned with /player command
extras: Set it to #none to stop adding a suffix

name: fakePlayerTicksLikeRealPlayer
description: Adjust the game phase where carpet's fake player logic and /player action packs are ticked, to make their behavior as close to real players as possible
extras: Adjustments, before -> after:
1. Fake player entity-related ticking: Entity Phase -> Network Phase
2. /player command action packs: Entity Phase -> Asynchronous Task Phase

name: fakePlayerRemoteSpawning
description: The permission requirement for spawning remotely a fake player with /player command
extras: Here "remotely" means spawning a fake player at more than 16m away, or in other dimension

name: farmlandTrampledDisabled
description: Disable farmland being able to be trampled into dirt by mobs

name: fillCommandModeEnhance
description: Enhance modes in the /fill command
extras: Add softreplace mode: Keep the block state of the original block as much as possible. You can use it to replace block type of stairs / slabs etc.

name: fluidDestructionDisabled
description: Disable block destruction by fluid flowing
extras: Fluid will just simple stopped at the state before destroying the block
It's useful to prevent liquid from accidentally flooding your redstone wiring in creative

name: hopperCountersUnlimitedSpeed
description: Make hopper pointing towards wool has infinity speed to suck in or transfer items with no cooldown
extras: Only works when hopperCounters option in Carpet Mod is on

name: hopperNoItemCost
description: Hopper with wool block on top outputs item infinitely without having its item decreased
extras: You can use the /scounter command or subscribe to the scounter logger to track the amount of the output items
This rule is also the switch of the /scounter command

name: hopperXpCounters
description: Make hopper counters be able to count experience amount from XP orbs
extras: When enabled, hopper counters will be able to "absorb" XP orbs and count their XP values
You can use the /xcounter command or subscribe to the xcounter logger to see the XP counter results
This rule is also the switch of the /xcounter command

name: HUDLoggerUpdateInterval
description: Overwrite HUD loggers update interval (gametick)

name: instantCommandBlock
description: Make command blocks on redstone ores execute command instantly instead of scheduling a 1gt delay TileTick event for execution
extras: Only affects normal command blocks

name: itemEntitySkipMovementDisabled
description: Removed the movement skipping mechanism when ticking of item entity
extras: Brings back <=1.13 item entity behavior, where item entities with low velocity on ground still tick movement every gt instead of every 4gt
Useful when you require precise item entity movement timing
Breaks related redstone devices, e.g. 2no2name's wireless redstone

name: keepMobInLazyChunks
description: The mobs in lazy chunks will not despawn
extras: This option only have effects between Minecraft 1.15 and 1.16

name: largeBarrel
description: The best storage block ever: Large barrel
extras: Two adjacent barrel blocks with their bottom side facing towards each other create a large barrel
The behavior and logic of large barrel is just like large chest

name: lifeTimeTrackerConsidersMobcap
description: Strategy for lifetime tracker to deal with mob that doesn't count towards mobcap
extras: true: Don't track mobs that don't count towards mobcap, and treat mobs as removal as soon as they don't affect mobcap e.g. right when they pick up some items. Good for mob farm designing
false: Tracks everything it can track and mark mobs as removal when they actually get removed. Good for raid testing Good for raid testing or non-mobfarms

name: lightEngineMaxBatchSize
description: Changes maximum light tasks batch size
extras: Allows for a higher light suppression tolerance
Setting it to 5 - Default limit defined by the game

name: lightQueueLoggerSamplingDuration
description: The sampling duration of light queue logger in game tick
extras: Affects all data except the queue size displayed in the logger

name: lightUpdates
description: Pause or disable light updates
extras: If set to suppressed, no light update can be executed which simulates light suppressor
If set to ignored, no light update can be scheduled. It's useful for creating light errors
If set to off, no light update can be scheduled or executed
[WARNING] If set to suppressed or off, new chunks cannot be loaded. Then if the server tries to load chunk for player movement or whatever reason the server will be stuck forever

name: loggerMovement
description: The switch / permission requirement of movement logger

name: manipulateBlockLimit
description: The maximum amount of affected block of the /manipulate block commands

name: microTiming
description: Enable the function of MicroTick logger
extras: Log and display redstone components actions, block updates and stacktrace with dye item
Use /log microTiming to start logging
Might impact the server performance when it's on
See description of rule microTimingDyeMarker for instructions of dye markers
[deprecated] Use wool blocks and end rods to mark blocks that need to be logged
[deprecated] End rods will detect block updates and redstone components will show their actions
[deprecated] - Observer, Piston, EndRod: pointing towards wool
[deprecated] - Repeater, Comparator, Rail, Button, etc.: placed on wool
[deprecated] Beside that, a universal block actions logging method is using EndRod on wool block to point on the block you want to log
[deprecated] Check rule microTimingTarget to see how to switch logging method

name: microTimingDyeMarker
description: Allow player to right click with dye item to mark a block to be logged by microTiming logger
extras: You need to subscribe to microTiming logger for marking or displaying blocks
Right click with the same dye to switch the marker to end rod mode with which block update information will be logged additionally. Right click again to remove the marker
Right click a marker with slime ball item to make it movable. It will move to the corresponding new position when the attaching block is moved by a piston
Use `/carpet microTimingDyeMarker clear` to remove all markers
You can create a named marker by using a renamed dye item. Marker name will be shown in logging message as well
You can see boxes at marked blocks with fabric-carpet installed on your client. With carpet-tis-addition installed the marker name could also be seen through blocks

name: microTimingTarget
description: Modify the way to specify events to be logged in microTiming logger. Events labelled with dye marker are always logged
extras: labelled: Logs events labelled with wool. Deprecated
in_range: Logs events within 32m of any player. Deprecated
all: Logs every event. Use with caution. Deprecated
marker_only: Logs event labelled with dye marker only. Use it with rule microTimingDyeMarker

name: microTimingTickDivision
description: Determine the way to divide game ticks
extras: world_timer: Divides at Overworld timer increment
player_action: Divides at the beginning of player action

name: minecartFullDropBackport
description: Backport the feature from Minecraft 1.19+ that minecart entity drops the full cart item on destroy
extras: Only works in Minecraft < 1.19

name: minecartPlaceableOnGround
description: Make minecart being able to be placed directly on ground without rails, like boat

name: minecartTakePassengerMinVelocity
description: Determine the minimum required horizontal velocity (m/gt) for a minecart to pick up nearby entity as its passenger
extras: Set it to 0 to let minecart always take passenger no matter how fast it is, just like a boat
Set it to NaN to let minecart never takes passenger

name: mobcapsDisplayIgnoreMisc
description: Ignore mob type "misc" in carpet mobcaps displays
extras: Since it's useless: Nothing in misc category spawns, and it's ignored when calculating mobcap
Affects mobcaps logger and /spawn mobcap command

name: naturalSpawningUse13Heightmap
description: Change the upper limit of the Y value during the initial coordinate selection in natural mob spawning, to the highest block that blocks light at that XZ position
extras: Basically, this rule reverts the use of the heightmap during natural spawning back to version 1.13 and earlier
Note: This will slightly increase lag during the natual spawning phase
See also: rule naturalSpawningUse13HeightmapExtra

name: naturalSpawningUse13HeightmapExtra
description: Ignore piston block, slime block, honey block when calculating the modified heightmap in rule naturalSpawningUse13Heightmap
extras: It's designed to keep the behavior unchanged from pre-1.13, but might introduce some unintended usage abuse

name: netherPortalMaxSize
description: Modify the maximum size limit of the nether portal
extras: Use with caution If you set it to a large value

name: oakBalloonPercent
description: The chance for oak sapling top grow into a balloon oak (fancy_oak) in percent
extras: e.g. 0 means no balloon oak, 50 means 50% balloon oak, 100 means always balloon oak
Set it to -1 to disable the rule and use vanilla logic (10% balloon oak)

name: obsidianPlatformBlockBreakerBackport
description: Backport the feature from Minecraft 1.21+ that the creation of the obsidian platform in the end dimension can break existing blocks
extras: Notes: block iterating order for obsidian platform creation for normal entity in vanilla [1.16, 1.21) is different from mc1.21+

name: observerNoDetection
description: Stop observer from scheduling tile tick event after it receives a state update
extras: Basically this rule disables the detection functionality of observers

name: opPlayerNoCheat
description: Disable some command to prevent accidentally cheating
extras: Affects command list: /gamemode, /tp, /teleport, /give, /setblock, /summon

name: optimizedFastEntityMovement
description: Optimize fast entity movement by only checking block collisions on current moving axis
extras: Inspired by the fastMovingEntityOptimization rule in carpetmod112
Use with rule optimizedTNT to greatly improve performance in cannons

name: optimizedHardHitBoxEntityCollision
description: Optimize entity colliding with entities with hard hit box
extras: It uses an extra separate list to store entities, that have a hard hit box including boat and shulker, in a chunk
It reduces quite a lot of unnecessary iterating when an entity is moving and trying to search entities with hard hit box on the way,since the world is always not filled with boats and shulkers
Enable it before loading the chunk to make it work. ~20% performance boost in portal mob farms
Might not work with other mods that add new entities
Known conflicted mods: async

name: optimizedTNTHighPriority
description: Use a Mixin injection with higher priority for carpet rule optimizedTNT
extras: So the rule optimizedTNT can overwrite lithium's explosion optimization
Of course rule optimizedTNT needs to be on for it to work

name: poiUpdates
description: Whether block changes will cause POI to updates or not
extras: Set it to false to disable POI updates

name: persistentLoggerSubscription
description: Remember the subscribed loggers as well as logging options of the player during server restart
extras: Only applies carpet's defaultLoggers rule at someone's first login
Logger subscriptions are saved in config/carpettisaddition/logger_subscriptions.json

name: preciseEntityPlacement
description: When placing / summoning entity with item, place the entity at the exact position of player's cursor target position
extras: Affected items: Spawn eggs, armorstand, ender crystal

name: railDupingFix
description: Disable rail duping using old school pushing lit powered or activator rail method

name: redstoneDustRandomUpdateOrder
description: Randomize the order for redstone dust to emit block updates
extras: It's useful to test if your contraption is locational or not
Does not work with rule fastRedstoneDust

name: renewableDragonEgg
description: Make dragon egg renewable
extras: When a dragon egg is in dragon breath effect cloud it has a possibility to absorb the effect cloud and "summon" a new dragon egg
Use with rule "dispensersFireDragonBreath" for more ease

name: renewableDragonHead
description: Ender dragon killed by charged creeper will drop dragon head

name: renewableElytra
description: Phantom killed by shulker will drops an elytra with given possibility
extras: Set it to 0 to disable

name: repeaterHalfDelay
description: Halve the delay of redstone repeaters upon a redstone ore
extras: The delay will change from 2, 4, 6 or 8 game tick instead of 1, 2, 3 or 4 game tick

name: sandDupingFix
description: Disable sand and other gravity block duping using end portal
extras: Gravity block includes sand, anvil, dragon egg and so on
In sand dupers sand will only get teleported to the other dimension

name: shulkerBoxContentDropBackport
description: Backport the feature that item entity of skulker box drops all of its contents when the item entity is damaged to die
extras: This feature is introduced to vanilla Minecraft in mc1.17

name: snowMeltMinLightLevel
description: The minimum light level allowed for snow to melt
extras: In vanilla the value is 12, which means snow will melt when the light level >=12 when random ticked
Set it to 0 to melt all annoying snow on your builds
Set it to the same level as the minimum light level for snow to not fall on block (light level 10) to easily test if your build is snow-proof with light or not
You can modify gamerule randomTickSpeed to speed up the melting progress, or modify carpet rule chunkTickSpeed to speed up the snowfall progress

name: spawnBabyProbably
description: When spawning mobs, if baby variant exists, spawn the baby variant with given probably
extras: Set it to -1 to disable the rule and use vanilla logic

name: spawnJockeyProbably
description: When spawning mobs, if jockey variant exists, spawn the jockey variant with given probably
extras: Affected jockeys: chicken jockey, spider jockey, strider jockey
For striders, the spawn ratio between zombified piglin and baby strider is still 1:3
Set it to -1 to disable the rule and use vanilla logic

name: speedTestCommandMaxTestSize
description: The max test size in MiB when using the /speedtest command for network speed test

name: stopCommandDoubleConfirmation
description: Add a double confirmation for /stop command to prevent stopping server accidentally
extras: You need to enter /stop twice within 1 minute to stop the server
This mechanics only works for players

name: structureBlockDoNotPreserveFluid
description: Structure block do not preserve existed fluid when placing waterlogged-able blocks
extras: Has a side effect of suppressing bug MC-130584 happening

name: structureBlockLimit
description: Overwrite the size limit of structure block
extras: Relative position might display wrongly on client side if it's larger than 32

name: structureBlockOutlineDistance
description: Customizable Structure Block outline render distance
extras: Required on client to work properly

name: synchronizedLightThread
description: Synchronize lighting thread with the server thread
extras: so the light thread will not lag behind the main thread and get desynchronized
The server will wait until all lighting tasks to be done at the beginning of each world ticking
With this rule you can safely /tick warp without potential light suppression or lighting desynchronization

name: syncServerMsptMetricsData
description: Sync server's mspt metrics data to the client, so players can see that in the debug screen with F3 + ALT
extras: Carpet TIS Addition is required to be installed on the client

name: tileTickLimit
description: Modify the limit of executed tile tick events per game tick

name: tiscmNetworkProtocol
description: The switch of the TISCM network protocol

name: tntDupingFix
description: Disable TNT, carpet and part of rail dupers
extras: Attachment block update based dupers will do nothing and redstone component update based dupers can no longer keep their duped block
Dupe bad dig good

name: tntFuseDuration
description: Overwrite the default fuse duration of TNT
extras: This might also affect the fuse duration of TNT ignited in explosion

name: tntIgnoreRedstoneSignal
description: Prevent TNT blocks from being ignited from redstone
extras: You can still use explosion etc. to ignite a tnt

name: tooledTNT
description: Tools on the player's main hand is applied to item dropping during the explosion caused by the player
extras: So you can ignite TNT to harvest blocks that require specific tool or enchantment as long as you are holding the right tool
For example, you can harvest ice with silk touch pickaxe, or harvest grass with shears
It also works for any other living entities beside player
Technically this rule applies the main hand item of the causing entity onto the loot table builder during the explosion

name: totallyNoBlockUpdate
description: Disable all block updates and state updates

name: toughWitherRose
description: Birth from death, wither rose is tough enough to be planted on any surface
extras: This rule removes all placement requirement of wither rose block, which means you're able to place wither rose at anywhere
It's useful when you want to play around with update suppressed wither roses for wither skeleton farms

name: turtleEggTrampledDisabled
description: Disable turtle egg trampled to broken

name: ultraSecretSetting
description: qOf DSh hwg ORRWHW Cb

name: undeadDontBurnInSunlight
description: Prevent undead creatures burning in sunlight
extras: Their helmets will still get damaged in sunlight though

name: updateSuppressionSimulator
description: Activator / Powered rail on a lapis ore simulates an update suppressor
extras: Right before a powered activator / powered rail on a lapis ore setting its powered state to false, throw the given JVM throwable
false: rule disabled; true: rule enable and use StackOverflowError; others: feature enable and use given throwable

name: violentNetherPortalCreation
description: Allows nether portal creation to ignore blocks already inside the frame, directly forcefully open the nether portal
extras: false: Rule disabled. The vanilla behavior
replaceable: Only allow ignoring replaceable blocks (e.g., fluids, grass)
all: Allow ignoring any blocks except obsidian. Obsidian cannot be ignored due to how portal frame is calculated
Notes: The forceful block replacements will cause no block updates, just like what vanilla does

name: visualizeProjectileLoggerEnabled
description: Enable visualize projectile logger
extras: Try /log projectiles visualize

name: voidDamageAmount
description: Modify the amount of void damage

name: voidDamageIgnorePlayer
description: Prevent players from taking void damage
extras: Completely harmless void for players, yay!
If the rule value is set to a comma-separated game mode list, then only players in these game modes are immutable to void damage

name: voidRelatedAltitude
description: Modify the related altitude between the bottom of the world and the void where entities will receive void damages

name: wetExplosionReintroduced
description: Reintroduced the wet-explosion from MC version 1.21.2 ~ 1.21.5
extras: If an explosion is created by an entity (e.g. primed TNT) and the entity is touching water, then the explosion does no damage to item entities, armor stand entities and all kinds of decoration entities
This rule has no effect in MC 1.21.2 ~ 1.21.5
See also: MC-3697

name: witherSpawnedSoundDisabled
description: Disable the wither spawned sound emitted when a wither fully reset its health after summoned

name: xpTrackingDistance
description: Overwrite the tracking distance of xp orb
extras: Change it to 0 to disable tracking

name: yeetAsyncTaskExecutionDelay
description: Ensure MinecraftServer's async server tasks are executed as soon as possible
extras: In vanilla, execution of async tasks can be skipped for up to 4 ticks when the server is tick-warping
This rule ensures async tasks are always executed at the nearest async-task phase

name: yeetIdleMspt
description: Suppress the appearance of idle mspt
extras: Some operations, such as chunk unloading and POI saving, may introduce idle mspt overhead
Idle mspt will only appear when the current game tick cost has not yet reached the lag limit (i.e., mspt is still below 50, and the server is not in tick warp)
When this rule is enabled, idle mspt will be suppressed. If the server is neither dropping ticks nor in tick warp, its mspt may be slightly reduced

name: yeetUpdateSuppressionCrash
description: Prevent the server from crashing due to StackOverflowError, OutOfMemoryError or ClassCastException
extras: Do the same thing as fabric carpet's updateSuppressionCrashFix rule, but with more information

name: customVersion
description: Set a custom version on client trying to connect to the server
extras: Use '_' to disable

name: cobwebSlowdownSpeed
description: Overwrite the slowdown speed of cobwebs

name: fakePlayerNameSuggestions
description: Overwrite the player list suggested when using /player command
extras: Use ',' to split each name

name: playerCommandNoControlSelf
description: Players can't control themselves using /player command

name: flippinCactusSound
description: Play 'BLOCK_DISPENSER_LAUNCH' sound when using cactus to flip block

name: editableSign
description: Use a sign block with main hand empty when you are sneaking to reopen the sign editor
extras: This rule only affects Minecraft < 1.20. Sign editing is supported in vanilla after 1.20

name: mobBlackList
description: Stop some mobs from spawning
extras: Use ',' to split each mob
Set rule 'mobSpawningRestrictionMode' to 'blacklist' to enable
Set rule 'mobSpawningRestrictionMode' to 'none' to disable

name: mobWhiteList
description: Only allow some mobs to spawn
extras: Use ',' to split each mob
Set rule 'mobSpawningRestrictionMode' to 'whitelist' to enable
Set rule 'mobSpawningRestrictionMode' to 'none' to disable

name: mobSpawningRestrictionMode
description: Modify the way to restrict mob spawning
extras: none: Disable mob spawning restriction
whitelist: Only mobs defined in rule 'mobWhiteList' can spawn in the world. Rule 'mobBlackList' will be ignored
blacklist: Mobs defined in rule 'mobBlackList' cannot spawn in the world. Rule 'mobWhiteList' will be ignored

name: creeperDropCompletely
description: Creeper explosions will have a 100% drop rate

name: creeperIgnitedByFire
description: Creepers can be ignited when they are on fire

name: pistonBedrockBreakingFix
description: Fix bedrock breaking with head-less piston
extras: Technically piston heads will not remove any block other than itself

name: blockEventChunkLoading
description: Block event can load 3x3 chunks for 8gt

name: mendableIronGolem
description: Use an iron ingot at an iron golem to mend it (+25 Health)

name: mendableSnowGolem
description: Use a snowball at a snow golem or hit a snow golem with a snowball to mend it (+1 Health)

name: spongeDryInNether
description: Wet sponge will transform to sponge immediately when placing in the nether
extras: Only works in 1.14

name: magmaBlockDamageItem
description: Items on magma block get damages

name: functionalSpongeItem
description: Sponge items do water clearance and dry in the nether after 60gt

name: fakePlayerPrefixRestriction
description: /player command will only be able to spawn fake players with the given prefix
extras: Set to '#none' to disable

name: fakePlayerSuffixRestriction
description: Player command will only be able to spawn fake players with the given suffix
extras: Set to '#none' to disable

name: infiniteWaterDisabled
description: Infinite water will not form

name: renewableSoulSand
description: A sand turn into a soul sand when a mob suffered in it

name: containerDropInventoryDisabled
description: Containers such as chests and barrels won't drop their inventories when being broke

name: endLightningRod
description: End rods will act like lightning rod in 1.17
extras: Lightning will NOT naturally spawn on end rods, but it will when end rods are hit by a trident with the Channeling enchantment
This rule only affects Minecraft < 1.17. Use vanilla lightning rod in 1.17+ instead

name: undeadImmuneToSunlight
description: Undead will not burn in sunlight
extras: If a undead is equipped with a helmet, the helmet will not be damaged

name: unbreakableHelmetInSunlight
description: Helmet equipped by an undead will not be damaged by sunlight

name: mobAlwaysPickUpLoot
description: Zombies and skeletons and their variants will always be able to pick up loot like other mobs

name: dispensersNotAffectPlayers
description: Dispensers will not dispense armor to players

name: icaSyncProtocol
description: A protocol to sync server data to client mods

name: stopFreezing
description: Stop generating ice at any biome

name: xpCounter
description: A tool like 'hopperCounter' to use players as xp counters

Use '/log xpcounter <players>' to subscribe xp counters

name: strictBlockPlacement
description: Player will not be able to do block placement on air (prevents litematica easyPlaceMode)

name: endermitesInconsistencyFix
description: Endermen will be hostile to endermites spawned by spawn eggs or /summon command (fixes MC-53518)

name: commandReplaceProperties
description: Enables /replaceproperties command for easily replacing properties of all blocks in a range

name: spawnEggSpawnWithMinecart
description: When using a spawn egg on a rail, the spawned entity will be placed in a minecart on the rail.

name: superBow
description: Enabling making super bows with both infinite and mending enchants

name: scheduledRandomTickCactus

name: scheduledRandomTickBamboo

name: scheduledRandomTickStem
description: Make stems accepts scheduled tick as random tick

name: scheduledRandomTickAllPlants
description: Make all plants accepts scheduled tick as random tick

name: optimizedDragonRespawn
description: Optimize dragon respawning

name: netherWaterPlacement
description: Players can use water buckets to place water in nether

name: blowUpEverything
description: Set all blocks BlastResistance to 0

name: sharedVillagerDiscounts
description: Share villagers discount to all players

name: fakePeace
description: Simulation fake Peace, You can customize the dimensions in which it works, or you can customize the combination and use "," to separate

name: extinguishedCampfire
description: The campfire is extinguished when the player places it

name: safeFlight
description: players don't get hurt by flying into walls

name: customBlockUpdateSuppressor

/carpet customBlockUpdateSuppressor minecraft:BlockName
Use the following command to control whether the "amsUpdateSuppressionCrashFix" rule is automatically enabled when this rule is enabled:
/amsUpdateSuppressionCrashFixForceMode true/false

name: infiniteTrades
description: Prevents villager trades from locking up

name: invulnerable
description: Players will be protected from all damage except Void Damage

name: creativeOneHitKill
description: Allows players in Creative mode to kill entities in one hit, If the player is sneaking, other entities around the target get killed too

name: largeEnderChest
description: Doubles the size of your EnderChest

name: bambooModelNoOffset

name: campfireSmokeParticleDisabled

[true] - Enable rule

extras: [overworld] - Only effective in the Overworld
[nether] - Only effective in the Nether
[end] - Only effective in the End
[all] - Effective in all dimensions

name: easyWitherSkeletonSkullDrop
description: 100% Wither Skeleton Skull Drop

name: commandAnvilInteractionDisabled

extras: Command: /anvilInteractionDisabled true/false

name: preventAdministratorCheat

/gamemode, /tp, /teleport, /give, /setblock, /summon, /difficulty, /kill, /time, /weather, /fill, /setblock, /enchant, /experience, /advancement, /effect, /data, /defaultgamemode, /gamerule

name: amsUpdateSuppressionCrashFix

name: Hopper Shulker Box Stacking
description:
Enables hopper transfers to stack empty shulker boxes when 'stackableShulkerBoxes' rule is enabled.
In the default state this rule prevents shulker box stacking for compatibility reasons.

name: Sync Stacked Shulker Count
description: Fixes displayed shulker amount on vanilla clients. See issue #1899 in Carpet's repo.

name: Legacy Shulker Item Merging
description:
Enables shulker box item merging logic Carpet used prior to the 1.20.5 update.
It allows partial item merging (i.e. 48 + 32 -> 64 + 16) and resets merging cooldown on every attempt.
Some contraptions like shulker box colour sorters relied on this behaviour and are broken without this rule.

name: Hoppers Collect Single Shulkers
description:
Prevents hoppers from picking up a whole item entity stack at once.
See also: 'minecartCollectSingleShulkers'.

name: Hopper Minecarts Collect Single Shulkers
description:
Prevents hopper minecarts from picking up a whole item entity stack at once.
See also: 'hopperCollectSingleShulkers'.

name: Overstacked Minecart Slowdown
description:
Changes behaviour of hopper and chest minecarts with stacked shulkers.
When enabled, minecarts with overstacked items will receive additional slowdown.
This functionality is affected by 'overstackedShulkerSignalStrength', 
which when set to 'false' will prevent minecart slowdown as well.

name: Overstacked Shulker Signal Strength
description:
Changes how stacked shulker boxes affect comparator output:
- 'true': Shulkers have signal strength of unstackable items, allowing comparator signal up to 897 (AKA OSS/HSS).
- 'false': Shulkers have signal strength of stackable items, reaching 15 when all slots are full (hoppers won't be able to fill over SS1).
- 'capped': Shulkers have signal strength of unstackable items, but the resulting output is capped at 15. This implementation preserves overstacked item filters.
- 'normalized': Any amount of shulkers in a slot is counted as a single unstackable item. This limits the output to signal strength 15 and patches overstacked item filters.
